content: Session initiated to evaluate EXAI MCP server configuration and fix provider implementation issues. User is experiencing problems with memory retention and provider errors.

Starting comprehensive EX-AI MCP Server validation and testing session. Goal: Fix registry issue, test all MCP functions, validate system operational status, and ensure full functionality by end of session.
Registry fix completed successfully. EX-AI MCP Server now has 30 tools available. Starting systematic testing of all MCP functions to validate AI responses and functionality.

Found registry import issue in src/providers/__init__.py. Fixed to use registry_core instead of registry. Still investigating why KimiProvider() is being called without api_key argument. Error persists after Docker restart. Need to find direct KimiProvider() instantiation in codebase.

Discovered that chat tool execution shows cache hit in logs, but error still occurs. Need to rebuild Docker container to ensure all code changes are applied. The error occurs during tool execution, not startup.

Issue persists after Docker rebuild. Chat tool still fails with KimiProvider missing api_key argument. Response shows 'from_cache': True, indicating cached error. Need to clear Redis cache and investigate further. The registry fix didn't resolve the root cause.

Fixed KimiProvider inheritance issue. Made KimiProvider inherit from ModelProvider base class and added the import. This should resolve the 'list_models' method missing error. Rebuilding Docker container to apply fix.
